pullRequest.body:
`μ + ν₁ = μ + ν₂ ↔ ν₁ = ν₂`, and similarly on the right. This is not true in general for measures, but is true when `μ` is mutually singular with the two other measures or when `μ` is finite.

---

nodes.body:
The `IsFiniteMeasure` conditions can be weakened to `SigmaFinite` measures. I did that in #7727.

The length of the proofs in the `MutuallySingular` file suggests that basic API is missing. For example, if `(h₁ : μ ⟂ₘ ν₁) (h₂ : μ ⟂ₘ ν₂)` then you can choose a witnessing set `s` that is the same for each of the two conditions, right? And then apply `Measure.ext_iff_of_sUnion_eq_univ` to `{s, sᶜ}` or something.

Note: I have pushed an update to the lean toolchain because this PR was on a [buggy version](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/113488-general/topic/Potential.20data.20loss.20from.20.60lake.20clean.60.20with.204.2E2.2E0-rc2.2F3/near/397875701) of the toolchain. **WARNING**: checking out old commits of this PR using v4.2.0-rc2 or v4.2.0-rc3 can cause `lake clean` to delete your mathlib folder! If you need to do so, make sure to delete `lakefile.olean` manually before running any `lake` commands.
~~Can you make this an `IsRightCancelAdd` instance instead? (and would you mind reviewing #7582 which adds more of the same instances?)~~
nevermind, that obviously doesn't work because `IsFiniteMeasure` is on one of the assumptions
I think this should be `add_right_inj`, the `cancel` lemma is the implication. We probably don't need both.

Indeed the regular `add_right_cancel` is an implication. It looks like the iff lemmas with the sum in that order are [add_right_cancel_iff](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Group/Defs.html#add_right_cancel_iff), and [add_left_inj](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Group/Defs.html#add_left_inj), which are apparently the same thing? I'll call this one similarly.

pullRequest.title: feat: add_left/right_inj for measures

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: properties of rnDeriv
[Merged by Bors] - feat: Prove Measure.add_right_inj for sigma-finite measures

nodes.body:
The `IsFiniteMeasure` conditions can be weakened to `SigmaFinite` measures. I did that in #7727.

The length of the proofs in the `MutuallySingular` file suggests that basic API is missing. For example, if `(h₁ : μ ⟂ₘ ν₁) (h₂ : μ ⟂ₘ ν₂)` then you can choose a witnessing set `s` that is the same for each of the two conditions, right? And then apply `Measure.ext_iff_of_sUnion_eq_univ` to `{s, sᶜ}` or something.

Note: I have pushed an update to the lean toolchain because this PR was on a [buggy version](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/113488-general/topic/Potential.20data.20loss.20from.20.60lake.20clean.60.20with.204.2E2.2E0-rc2.2F3/near/397875701) of the toolchain. **WARNING**: checking out old commits of this PR using v4.2.0-rc2 or v4.2.0-rc3 can cause `lake clean` to delete your mathlib folder! If you need to do so, make sure to delete `lakefile.olean` manually before running any `lake` commands.
